message.content:
cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.DB. 

The paper deals with the trade-offs between accuracy and privacy in the context of linear queries over histograms, which is a problem in the intersection of several sub-fields of computer science. The paper uses tools from convex geometry, linear regression, and information theory, suggesting that cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) and cs.IT (Information Theory) are likely sub-categories. The paper also deals with sparse data, which suggests that cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.DB (Databases) are also likely sub-categories. Finally, the paper uses approximation algorithms, which suggests that cs.LG (Machine Learning) is also a possible sub-category.
